key_issues: Lychee (Casablanca Holdings) tenant absconded - legal proceedings underway. Section 65 hearing 24 Nov could not trace. Balance R381,155.
Vodacom Antenna (Mast Services) renewal not concluded - R211,499 in arrears. Old rates applied, debit note raised Dec 2025.
The Water Shop vacated store end September 2025 - new lease with Butlersafrica (Pty) Ltd from Oct 2025. Shop L1.1A vacant 3 months, loss R22,325.
Revenue YTD 35.1% below budget - primarily due to income received on RA side not yet finalized in adjustment account, and Vape Gurus renewal not loaded.
Municipal electricity back-billing from 19 August 2025 received in December - council accounts newly received. Actual 106%, Budget 139%.
Total safety net negative R294,389 as at Dec 2025 - projected to recover to R90,124 by Feb 2026.
Biltong Republic in payment arrangement R4K/month but still in arrears R57,143.

net_income_entity_vs_property.explanation: PDF net income (YTD actual) = R2,142,134. GL ebitda_recurring = R-1,711,612.92 (negative = profit in GL sign convention, so R1,711,613 profit). Difference of R430,521 likely due to: (1) Broll property report covers property-level operations only while GL includes entity-level items like ad-hoc fees R341,899 and R2,837,092, tenant installation allowances R147,987; (2) GL includes finance charges R6,167,208 embedded in opex which are excluded from property NOI; (3) GL ebitda_recurring is adjusted for non-recurring items (solar income, FV adjustment) while Broll report is purely operational; (4) Different period cut-offs (GL 10-month cumulative vs Broll adjusted YTD).

revenue_report_vs_gl.explanation: PDF total income (YTD actual) = R5,350,363. GL gross_profit = R-6,701,888.88 (negative = revenue in GL, so R6,701,889). Difference of R1,351,526 because: (1) GL gross_profit includes total_revenue R6,670,311 + cost_of_sales (diesel recoveries) R31,578 while Broll report splits revenue across rent, recoveries, and other income differently; (2) GL other_income R5,311,338 includes municipal recoveries and operating cost recoveries that Broll classifies under income; (3) GL total_revenue includes rebates/remissions R-14,883 deducted; (4) The Broll income statement is a property management view (operational) while GL is a full entity accounting view.

insured_vs_book.explanation: Building sum insured R109,200,000 (from Broll management report) vs AFS investment property R120,300,000 (28 Feb 2025 year-end). Insurance is 90.8% of book value. The under-insurance of R11.1M (9.2%) may reflect: (1) investment property carried at fair value includes land value not typically insured; (2) insurance covers replacement cost of building structure only; (3) fair value includes income capitalization premium above replacement cost. GL fixed assets at Dec 2025 = R126,753,138 (includes FV adjustments). Municipal valuation = R21,100,000 (significantly below both).

_computation_notes.trading_density: R231,266,450 total T/O YTD / 5,843 m2 leased area reporting / ~9.27 months reporting = R4,268.48/m2/annum (annual T/O density from turnover schedule)

_computation_notes.weighted_escalation: Weighted by GLA: Checkers 1362*5% + Liquorshop 224*0% + Medirite 514*0% + La Parada 546*5% + Bootlegger 232*0% + Pressed In Time 74*8% + Neovision 74*0% + Wa Zen 74*0% + Lychee 109*0% + Yashvi 74*7% + Vape Gurus 74*0% + Water Shop 74*0% + Doggies 148*0% + Biltong 21*5% + Fix Tech 74*5% + Storage 1308*0% + Pizza Perfect 97*0% + Postlink 74*0% + FNB ATM 9*0% + Nedbank ATM 9*6% + MTN 1*7% + Vodacom 1*5% + Bob Box 1*0% = total weighted esc 10698 + 2730 + 592 + 105 + 518 + 370 + 54 + 5 = ~15072 / (5521-55 vacant) = ~2.76%. However using rent-weighted: (Checkers ~R201K*5% + La Parada est ~R60K*5% + MTN R26K*7% + Yashvi est ~R30K*7% + Pressed In Time est ~R31K*8% + others at 0%) gives approx 4.38%. Rent-weighted escalation = 4.38%.
